title: The Existence and Stability of Noncommutative Scalar Solitons
abstract: We establish existence and stabilty results for solitons in noncommutative scalar field theories in even space dimension $2d$. In particular, for any finite rank spectral projection $P$ of the number operator ${\mathcal N}$ of the $d$-dimensional harmonic oscillator and sufficiently large noncommutativity parameter $\theta$ we prove the existence of a rotationally invariant soliton which depends smoothly on $\theta$ and converges to a multiple of $P$ as $\theta\to\infty$. In the two-dimensional case we prove that these solitons are stable at large $\theta$, if $P=P_N$, where $P_N$ projects onto the space spanned by the $N+1$ lowest eigenstates of ${\mathcal N}$, and otherwise they are unstable. We also discuss the generalisation of the stability results to higher dimensions. In particular, we prove stability of the soliton corresponding to $P=P_0$ for all $\theta$ in its domain of existence. Finally, for arbitrary $d$ and small values of $\theta$, we prove without assuming rotational invariance that there do not exist any solitons depending smoothly on $\theta$.
